column3: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

column5: Black Hawk Down broke Save the Last Dance's record ($23.4 mil) for the highest Martin Luther King weekend debut.
John Q. broke The Wedding Singer's record ($18.9 mil) for the highest President's Day weekend debut.
Ice Age broke Liar Liar's record ($31.4 mil) for the highest weekend debut in March.
The Scorpion King broke The Matrix's record ($27.8 mil) for the highest weekend debut in April.

Spider-Man broke Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone's record ($90.3 mil) for the highest weekend debut of all-time, and The Lost World: Jurassic Park's record ($72.1 mil) for the highest weekend debut in May and X-Men's record ($54.4 million) for highest weekend debut for a Superhero film. Spider-Man was the first film ever to gross more than $100 million in 3 days, and had the highest weekend debut of 2002.
Spider-Man broke Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone's record ($57.5 mil) for the highest second weekend gross.

column3: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones
column5: Meanwhile, Spider-Man broke Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace's record ($32.8 mil) for the highest third weekend gross.

column3: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones

column5: Men in Black II broke Men in Black's record ($51.1 mil) for the highest Fourth of July weekend debut.
Road to Perdition reached #1 in its second weekend of release. Initial estimates had Stuart Little 2 ahead of Road to Perdition.
Austin Powers in Goldmember broke Planet of the Apes's record ($68.5 mil) for the highest weekend debut in July.
Signs reclaimed #1 in its fourth weekend of release.
Sweet Home Alabama broke Rush Hour's record ($33.0 mil) for the highest weekend debut in September.
Red Dragon broke Meet the Parents's record ($28.6 mil) for the highest weekend debut in October and for any fall release.

column3: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
column5: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets reclaimed #1 in its third weekend on Thanksgiving Holiday.
Die Another Day reclaimed #1 in its third weekend of release.

column3: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
column5: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers broke The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring's record ($47.2 mil) for the highest weekend debut in December.

column3: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
